Module com.alike
Package com.alike.graphsystem

Class DynamicGraph

java.lang.Object
com.alike.graphsystem.DynamicGraph
All Implemented Interfaces:
Graph
public class DynamicGraph extends Object implements Graph
Class combines the @code{StaticGraph} and @code{CoordinateMover} classes to create a dynamic travelling salesperson problem graph where the nodes move.

  • Constructor Details

    • DynamicGraph

      public DynamicGraph(StaticGraph graph, boolean stepRandomly, boolean stepByVelocity)
      Constructs a new DTSP object.
      Parameters:
      graph - The underlying graph object of the DTSP.
      stepRandomly - Whether the nodes are moved using the stepRandomly method in the coordinate mover.
      stepByVelocity - Whether the nodes are moved using the stepByVelocity method in the coordinate mover.

    • DynamicGraph

      public DynamicGraph(StaticGraph graph, boolean stepRandomly, boolean stepByVelocity, int movementSpeed)
      Constructs a new @code{DynamicGraph} object.0
      Parameters:
      graph - The static graph the coordinate mover will manipulate.
      stepRandomly - Whether the coordinate mover should move the nodes randomly.
      stepByVelocity - Whether the coordinate mover should move the nodes by a velocity.
      movementSpeed - How fast the coordinate mover should move the nodes.

  • Method Details

    • setSteppingRandomly

      Sets the @code{steppingRandomly} attribute to a new value.

    • setSteppingByVelocity

      public void setSteppingByVelocity(boolean steppingByVelocity)
      Sets the @code{steppingByVelocity} attribute to a new value.
      Parameters:
      steppingByVelocity - The new value to assign the @code{steppingByVelocity} attribute.

    • wake

      public void wake()
      Sets the value of the @code{awake} attribute to true and starts the coordinate mover thread. This state allows this object to listen for move and stop commands that resume or pause movement of the nodes.

    • kill

      public void kill()
      Sets the value of the @code{awake} attribute to false which kills the mover's listener thread.

    • move

      public void move()
      Sets the value of the @code{moving} attribute to true which will resume the coordinate's movement.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Sets the value of the @code{moving} attribute to false which will pause the coordinate's movement.

    • setDelayPerStep

      public void setDelayPerStep(int delayPerStep)
      Sets the value of the @code{delayPerStep} attribute to a new value. This is the pause between each tick or movement of nodes on this graph.
      Parameters:
      delayPerStep - The new value to assign to the @code{delayPerStep} attribute.

    • toStorageFormat

      public String toStorageFormat(char delimiter) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Outputs the values of this graph as a string that can be stored in file and later read back into program.
      Specified by:
      toStorageFormat in interface Graph
      Parameters:
      delimiter - The character used to separate graph information.
      Returns:
      string The information in this dynamic graph represented as a string to be stored and read later.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • fromStorageFormat

      public static DynamicGraph fromStorageFormat(String storageFormatString, char delimiter, int speed, boolean randomMovement, boolean velocityMovement) throws NodeSuperimpositionException
      Loads a dynamic graph from storage format i.e. cx1,cy1;cx2,cy2;cxn,cyn;;vx1,vy1;vx2,vy2
      Parameters:
      storageFormatString - The dynamic graphs string representation.
      delimiter - The delimiter used to separate graph information.
      speed - The speed the graph nodes should be set to.
      randomMovement - Whether the nodes should have step randomly on.
      velocityMovement - Whether the nodes should have step by velocity on.
      Returns:
      dg A dynamic graph with nodes starting at the written places and starting velocities of the written vectors.
      Throws:
      NodeSuperimpositionException - Thrown if an attempt is made to create a node where one already lies.
